  • Constructor Details

    • Notify

      public Notify​(com.vaadin.flow.component.UI notifyUI)

  • Method Details

    • requestPermission

      public void requestPermission()
      Request the permission to send notifications to the user.

    • getPermission

      public boolean getPermission()
      Returns if the permission has been granted by the user (returned value may not be synced). Use runAfterGetPermission(Runnable) if you want to make sure, the value is 100 % up to date with the server.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • runAfterGetPermission

      public void runAfterGetPermission​(java.lang.Runnable action)
      Gets the current permission and lets you use it in the given action, after the permission has been updated.
      Parameters:
      action - Runnable

    • sendNotification

      public Notification sendNotification​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String body, java.lang.String icon)
      Send a notification to the user. Make sure you requested the permission already requestPermission(). Only the Notification.onClick(com.vaadin.flow.component.ComponentEventListener) and the Notification.onClose(com.vaadin.flow.component.ComponentEventListener) events will work due to the other events being sent before the listeners can be added. If you want to listen to those events aswell, be sure to use createNotification(String, String) or createNotification(String, String, String) afterwards add the listeners you need and use Notification.send() / Notification.send(int) to send the notification.
      Parameters:
      title - the title
      body - the description
      icon - an url to the icon (can also be an uri or filepath)
      Returns:
      Notification

    • sendNotification

      public Notification sendNotification​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String body)
      Send a notification to the user. Make sure you requested the permission already requestPermission(). Only the Notification.onClick(com.vaadin.flow.component.ComponentEventListener) and the Notification.onClose(com.vaadin.flow.component.ComponentEventListener) events will work due to the other events being sent before the listeners can be added. If you want to listen to those events aswell, be sure to use createNotification(String, String) or createNotification(String, String, String) afterwards add the listeners you need and use Notification.send() / Notification.send(int) to send the notification.
      Parameters:
      title - the title
      body - the description
      Returns:
      Notification

    • createNotification

      public Notification createNotification​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String body, java.lang.String icon)
      Creates a notification but doesn't send it right away. Make sure to use Notification.send() or Notification.send(int) to send it to the user.
      Parameters:
      title - title of the notification
      body - body of the notification
      icon - icon of the notification (uri, filepath or url)
      Returns:
      Notification

    • createNotification

      public Notification createNotification​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String body)
      Creates a notification but doesn't send it right away. Make sure to use Notification.send() or Notification.send(int) to send it to the user.
      Parameters:
      title - title of the notification
      body - body of the notification
      Returns:
      Notification
